newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Foreign direct investment in Brazil $300 mln Feb.
newsitem.headline: Foreign direct investment in Brazil $300 mln Feb.

text.p: Foreign direct investment into Brazil was slightly more than $300 million in February, said Jose Roberto Mendonca de Barros, Economic Policy Secretary at the Finance Ministry.
Mendonca de Barros told reporters that foreign direct investment in the first week of March was $300 million.
Mendonca de Barros gave the investment figures at a briefing to explain a $2.03 billion trade deficit for the period of January and February.
The Economic Policy Secretary said he was not overly concerned about the trade gap because of the strong foreign direct investment flow, which would help finance Brazil's current account deficit.
Foreign direct investment into Brazil was $800 million in January after $9.94 billion for the whole of 1996, according to Central Bank figures.
